lines.content: * Duke is a Command Line Interface chat-bot application designed to assist the user in scheduling
* and keeping track of todos, deadlines and events.
private final File DATA_DIRECTORY = new File("data");
* Constructs Duke object by initializing ui, storage and TaskList. TaskList is initialized with
* stored tasks if a valid storage file is found
* Shows users Starting or Ending Messages and starts running Duke
* Runs Duke and continuously executes user commands until user issues the "bye" command
* Adds a deadline to the TaskList
* @param description the description of the deadline to be added
* @param by          the date and time by when the deadline has to be completed
* Executes the AddDeadLineCommand by adding it to the TaskList and storage file.
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws IOException {
* Returns a Deadline with the description and time-limit of this.description and this.by. The Deadline's
* by is a LocalDateTime if it is parsable in the format of "d/M/yyyy HHmm" and a String if it is not.
* @return Deadline object with description and by the same as this AddDeadLineCommand object
* Adds an event to the TaskList
* @param at          time that the event is scheduled at
* Executes the AddEventCommand by adding the event to the TaskList and storage file.
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws IOException {
* Returns an Event with the description and time-limit of this.description and this.at. The Event's
* at is a LocalDateTime if it is parsable in the format of "d/M/yyyy HHmm" and a String if it is not.
* @return Event object with description and by the same as this AddEventCommand object
* Adds a todo to the task list
* Executes the AddTodoCommand by adding the todo to the TaskList and storage file.
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws IOException {
* Shows the user all the events/deadlines that are at/due today
* Executes AgendaCommand by printing all events/deadline that equals LocalDate.now()
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
//TODO change this to LocalDate.now() in final release
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for reading from/writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
* @throws DukeException Usually occurs in DeleteTaskCommand and MarkAsDoneCommand where either the
*                       task index is invalid or the task is already completed
* @throws IOException   if an I/O error occurs
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws DukeException, IOException;
* @param indexOfTask 1-based index of the task that is to be deleted
* Executes command by deleting task and refreshing storage file to reflect the changes
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for reading from/writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
*                              (greater than no. of tasks or less than 0)
* @throws IOException          if an I/O error occurs
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws DukeInvalidTaskIndex,
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for reading from/writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Shows the user all tasks related to his query
* Executes FindCommand by printing all tasks matching the user query
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for reading from/writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for reading from/writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* Marks a task as done in the TaskList and storage file
* @param indexOfTaskDone 1-based index of the task that has been completed
* Executes command by setting the task as done in TaskList and refreshes the storage file to reflect the
* @param tasks   the TaskList that contains all current tasks
* @param storage the storage object responsible for reading from/writing to the data file
* @param ui      the ui object responsible for acknowledging to user that the command has been executed
*                                           (greater than no. of tasks or less than 0)
* @throws DukeTaskAlreadyCompletedException if task at indexOfTaskDone has already been completed
* @throws IOException                       if an I/O error occurs
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws DukeInvalidTaskIndex,
* This exception is thrown when the description of the task is missing when adding a task
errorMessage = "Please enter a description of the task";
* This exception is thrown when the time-field while adding a deadline or event is missing
* Abstract class to define the behaviour of all exceptions that Duke can throw
public abstract class DukeException extends Exception {
* @return errorMessage String of each exception which is different for each DukeException
* Thrown when there is no query after "find" found in the user input
errorMessage = "Please enter something to search for after 'find'";
* Thrown when the task index of a task being deleted/set-as-done is greater than the number of tasks or
errorMessage = "Please enter valid task index number";
* Thrown when either the "/by" for deadline or "/at" for event is missing when creating a new event or
* @param keyword keyword is either "/at" or "/by depending on whether an event or deadline was being added
this.errorMessage = "No " + keyword + " detected, press enter to see command syntax";
* Thrown when an already completed task is being set as done again
* Thrown when the user inputs a command not recognised by duke
* Parses through the user input to identify and prepare the command to be executed
* Parses through and makes sense of the user input to return the correct Command object corresponding
* @return Command object corresponding to the user command
* @throws InvalidCommandException        when command is not recognised
* @throws NumberFormatException          when the user input does not contain a valid integer as index
*                                        number of task after done or delete
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when the user input does not contain any index number of task
* @throws DukeEmptyDescriptionException  when the description of task is empty
* @throws DukeEmptyTimeException         when the time-field is empty for event or deadline
* @throws DukeMissingKeywordException    when there is no "/at" or "/by" when adding a new event or
public static Command parse(String input) throws InvalidCommandException,
* @return MarkAsDoneCommand object which can be executed to mark a task as done
* @throws NumberFormatException          when the user input does not contain a valid integer as index
*                                        number of task after done or delete
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when the user input does not contain any index number of task
private static MarkAsDoneCommand prepareMarkAsDoneCommand(String input) throws NumberFormatException,
* @return FindCommand object which can be executed to find a print all tasks matching a query
* @throws DukeInvalidQueryException when there is no query found in user input
private static FindCommand prepareFindCommand(String input) throws DukeInvalidQueryException {
* @return DeleteTaskCommand object which can be executed to delete a task
* @throws NumberFormatException          when the user input does not contain a valid integer as index
*                                        number of task after done or delete
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when the user input does not contain any index number of task
private static DeleteTaskCommand prepareDeleteTaskCommand(String input) throws NumberFormatException,
* @return AddTodoCommand object which can be executed to add a todo
* @throws DukeEmptyDescriptionException when there is no description in the user input
private static AddTodoCommand prepareAddTodoCommand(String input) throws DukeEmptyDescriptionException {
* @return AddDeadlineCommand object which can be executed to add a deadline
* @throws DukeEmptyDescriptionException when there is no description in the user input
* @throws DukeEmptyTimeException        when there is no time-field in user input
* @throws DukeMissingKeywordException   when "/by" cannot be found in user input
private static AddDeadlineCommand prepareAddDeadlineCommand(String input) throws
* @return AddEventCommand object which can be executed to add an event
* @throws DukeEmptyDescriptionException when there is no description in the user input
* @throws DukeEmptyTimeException        when there is no time-field in user input
* @throws DukeMissingKeywordException   when "/at" cannot be found in user input
private static AddEventCommand prepareAddEventCommand(String input) throws
* @param indexOfPrefix index of "/at" or "/by" prefix in user input String
* @return String corresponding to the time-field of the deadline/event
* @throws DukeEmptyTimeException when no time-field is detected in user input
private static String getTime(String input, int indexOfPrefix) throws DukeEmptyTimeException {
* @param indexOfPrefix index of "/at" or "/by" prefix in user input String
* @return String corresponding to the description of the event/deadline
* @throws DukeEmptyDescriptionException when no description detected in user input
private static String getDescription(String input, int indexOfPrefix) throws
* @return integer corresponding ot the index of "/by" in user input
* @throws DukeMissingKeywordException when no "/by" is detected in user input
private static int getIndexOfByPrefix(String input) throws DukeMissingKeywordException {
* @return integer corresponding to the index of "/at" in user input
* @throws DukeMissingKeywordException when no "/at" is detected in user input
private static int getIndexOfAtPrefix(String input) throws DukeMissingKeywordException {
* @return String corresponding to the first word in the user input
//switch to lowercase so that Duke won't be case-sensitive
* @param lengthOfFirstWord length of the first word in the sentence
* @return String corresponding to the user input with the first word removed from it
private static String removeFirstWordInSentence(String inputCommand, int lengthOfFirstWord) {
* parses the 2nd word in the user input into an integer and returns it
* @return the integer in the 2nd word of the user input corresponding to the index of a task
* @throws NumberFormatException          when the 2nd word of the user input cannot be parsed into an integer
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when the user input does not have a 2nd word
private static int getIntegerFromCommand(String input) throws NumberFormatException,
* Loads and stores data into a data file inside a specific data directory
* @param dataDirectory Directory where the data file is to be inside
* @param dataFile      File which contains the stored data
* loads all tasks found in the data file into an ArrayList<Task>
* @return ArrayList<Task> containing all the tasks loaded from the data file
* @throws FileNotFoundException when no data file exists
* @throws SecurityException     when data directory not found and cannot be created using mkdirs
* takes in a task and adds it to the data file
* @param task          Task to be added to the data file
* @param numberOfTasks number of tasks in the data file after adding the task
public void writeToData(Task task, int numberOfTasks) throws IOException {

* @param tasks ArrayList with all the tasks to be written into the data file
public void refreshData(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {

* Converts the task into a String to be printed for the user to see

* @throws DukeTaskAlreadyCompletedException when the task with index taskNumber is already completed

* @param isDone whether the todo is done or not
* Converts the task into a String fit for being stored into a data file

* Scans commands from user and prints results
public static final String NL = System.lineSeparator();
private final String HELP_MESSAGE = "Valid Commands: " + NL
+ "event {description of event} /at {time of event} (eg. event party at/ 9am)" + NL
+ "deadline {description of task} /by {deadline of task}  (eg. deadline assignment /by 6pm)"
+ "done {index number of task done}  (eg. done 1)" + NL
+ "delete {index number of task you want to delete}  (eg. delete 1)" + NL
private final String STARTING_MESSAGE = "Hello from" + NL
private final String ENDING_MESSAGE = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
private final Scanner SCANNER = new Scanner(System.in);
* Prints a message in the middle of two horizontal lines
* Prints the starting message if isStart == STARTING_MESSAGE (true), else prints the ENDING_MESSAGE
* @param isStart set to true to print starting message and false otherwise
* Acknowledges that a task has been added
* @param task          task that has been added
* @param numberOfTasks current total number of tasks after the task is added
public void acknowledgeAddCommand(Task task, int numberOfTasks) {
+ NL + "has been added. You now have "
* Prints all the tasks in a suitable format to the user
* @param tasks ArrayList of all the tasks to be printed
* Acknowledges that a task has been set as done
* @param taskDone task that has been completed
showMessage("Good Job!! I've marked this task as done:" + NL
* Acknowledges that a task has been removed
* @param removedTask   task that has been removed
* @param numberOfTasks current total number of tasks after the task is removed
public void acknowledgeRemoveCommand(Task removedTask, int numberOfTasks) {
showMessage("I have removed the task: " + NL + removedTask.toString()
+ NL + "You now have " + numberOfTasks + " tasks remaining");
* Prints out all the deadlines or events that are due/at today
* @param tasks list of all deadlines or events that are due/at today

System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* Print message consisting of all valid commands to the user
* @param de the DukeException that has occurred
System.out.println("WARNING - Data Directory could not be created due to insufficient permissions");
showMessage("WARNING - Error in saving data to file (IOException has occurred)");
showMessage("Please enter a valid number after 'done' or 'delete'");
